descriptionSet.description: The goddess Lakshmi is depicted, wearing a rose coloured Sari and standing on a lotus flower in the middle of a small lake. In the background an elephant, some swans, a river, several trees and a mountain can be seen.

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

rights.text: Copyrighted. Copyright with the original artists and publishers.

hra:item.hra:value: description-en: The goddess Lakshmi is depicted, wearing a rose coloured Sari and standing on a lotus flower in the middle of a small lake. In the background an elephant, some swans, a river, several trees and a mountain can be seen. (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Generally, subsequent poster artists have not appropriated Varmaâ€™s narrative scenes, but certain iconic designs of his have provided the starting point for prolific artistic adaptation. These themes include his renderings of standing Lakshmi, seated Sarasvati, and the family of Shiva. (Richard H. Davis)(gs)
explanatory comments/crosstagging: The original design dates back to c. 1894. (sg)
related literature: Davis, Richard H. 2010. "Temple in a Frame. God Posters For and Of Worship" http://www.tasveergharindia.net/cmsdesk/essay/97/index.html (09.01.2011)(gs)
related literature: Neumayer, Erwin and Christine Schellberger 2003. "Popular Indian Art. Raja Ravi Varma and the printed gods of India." New Delhi: Oxford University Press. (gs)
related literature: Ravi Varma, Raja and I.M.E. Veniyoor 2007. "Ravi Varma Raji. the most celebrated painter of India, 1848 - 1906" Bangalore: Parsram Mangharam. (gs)
